answers.answer: Has she had a spinal tap?
Thanks, Nope she does not have spinal tap. Its very wired she was fine doing her job, one morning she got up and she had all the issues and since then these things are there.

Hi,How are you?The symptoms of tingling numbness on one side of the body can be due to peripheral neuropathy due to diabetes or B12 deficiency, nerve compression at the cervical level.Since the symptoms are acute neurological causes like brain tumors also cannot be ruled out.Has she undergone MRI of brain and neck?Please advise her to consult an experienced neurologist and discuss these possibilities.Take care!

Thanks for the response. Diabetes test has been done, and other test like MRI Scan of brain and neck is also done, all the reports are normal. She did meet a neurologist, he said that he feels that there is no need for any test if you want then you can go for needle test.All the Drs have said that she is suffering from nerve compression, but i fail to understand that can it be so bad, like all the time she faces weakness and numbness. And does it take so long to heal.
Did your friend every find out anything else about her tingling?

question: Hello ,One of my close friend, is facing numbness and tingling sensation on the left side of the body. She all the time feels tired and exhausted. She is facing this problem since last 2 years, since 2 yrs she is virtually on bed.The numbness and tingling problem is there all the time, even though she is sleeping and if she does any work she feels week.She has visited many doctors and done MRI scan, ECG, Thyroid test but all her reports are normal. Even has tried Homeopathy and Ayurvedic treatment.All have said that it is because of stiffness, but none were able to cure the problem.Has anyone faced such problem?
title: Numbness and  tingling problem
